text: Klares Gold mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, reichlich Vanille, etwas Honig, Kekse, getreidig.
It is very cream soda as the blurb says honey vanilla i dont mind a sweet beer but some counterbalance wouldnt go amiss for me.

12 oz single from Total Wine & More - Laguna Hills, consumed via can on a camping trip. Aroma of vanilla, cream soda, light grains and a touch of honey. Similar flavor, a one-dimensional novelty beer for the most part. Light and easy to drink overall.

This is a fantastic beverage. Easy drinking Cali goodness. On the beach, or beachside bungalow, or perhaps a lovely city park - extra refreshing and pleasurable in the sunshine

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from Hippo. Hmm. Its a bit niche for me. Cream soda in the nose, for sure. Given it a 7 for that, though Im not sure how difficult it is to just make a beer that smells of cream soda. Looks lovely in the glass - Mother Earth stuff always does - but overall a bit confusing for me. Tastes of cream soda then it tastes of beer then it tastes of cream soda. Now: I like cream soda...and I like beer. But Im not massively keen on them both in the same 5 seconds.
This is a 2017 backlog entry. I may add more details on this beer at a future time.

Can from Hippo Beers, Glasgow. Beer served in 5°C, Duvel Glass. Pours hazy yellow, with a little and quickly disappearing head. Aroma is similar to soda shake with condensed milk and vanilla. Coconut, banana and lime notes are also noticeable. Flavor is milky, creamy, powdery vanilla, not well balanced with medium bitterness and watery finish. Anyway beer is interesting and unique.
Golden white head.vanilla nose. Tastey, creamy. A tad sweet but over looking the ocean its perfect
Vanilla cream ale. Wow. So interesting. Strong vanilla but not super sweet.
No body and no head. Nose perfect vanilla. Taste is light grain and vanilla. Nothing special in this beer but vanilla. little body. meh
Strong vanilla soda aroma. Flavors are a bit more subtle but still distinct with a lot of character.

12 oz can at home bought from Beergonzo. Canned 06/20/2016. yellow hazy color, small white head. smells berry notes, some currant, light sweetness, creamy. decent smell. light to medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes flowery, berry notes, chewing gum, light sweet currant notes again, lightly herbal. finishes lightly sweet and lightly bitter with notes of sweet red currant, bubble gum, flowers and lightly citric. okish beer, but also not very exciting, might be better a bit fresher..

Poured from a 22 oz bottle. Its tough to tell if the bottle code is a date, but it looks like it may be from June, 2016; thanks Whole Foods! :( 
Aroma has moderate honey notes with some lighter corn. Quite a bit of vanilla character. No hop aromas and just some faint floral esters. 
Pours a fairly clear, golden color with a small, moderately thick, white head that recedes to a film that lingers for quite some time. Moderately high lacing and faint legs. 
Flavor is somewhat sweet upfront and a bit sweeter mid-palate, but it finishes drier than I was expecting which is nice. Medium bitterness in the finish. Light honey and corn notes. No hop flavor. Medium vanilla notes, but definitely less than in the aroma. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied and somewhat crisp, but a bit flabby on the edges with moderate carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, better than I was expecting, but I also had pretty low expectations. The vanilla is too strong in the aroma, but it is better in the flavor. Flavor has a bit of a weird transition from front of palate to mid and late palate.
12 oz can pours light gold with frothy head aroma and taste is vanilla and caramel

Pours clear topaz with a thick and persistent pancake-batter head. Aroma delivers fresh, creamy malt and hay notes plus a hint of apple. Flavor nicely echoes the aroma while upping the apple character. Smooth mouthfeel presents good body, fair fizz, and a fruity and hay finish. California Creamin indeed!

Draft @ Brewskis Bar & Arcade, San Diego, CA. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty creamy aroma with weak hints of citrus. Fruity malty creamy hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty creamy hoppy finish.

Appearance: Light orange, slightly hazy. Tiny fizzy head.
Aroma: Light malt, light fruits, light caramel.
Taste: Quite strong vanilla, light malt and fruits. Some sweetness.
Bought: Beers of Europe, 355 ml can, £2.49
Info: 22/3-2017, BB: 30/9-2017

Sweet and smooth cream Ale with honey and sweet caramel corn flavours and big biscuity aftertaste. It reminds me of my great grandfather who would eat Weet bix with honey and warm water. As a little kid I thought that was weird. This tastes like that breakfast.

Yellow-gold with a quickly disappearing white head. Faint aroma of vanilla and cereal. Definite vanilla flavor - though it comes across as artificial. Appropriately low bitterness and light body. Would have much preferred this without the vanilla and just as a cream ale. Oh well.

Light grainy bready corn malt aroma with subtle vanilla
Pours a clear amber color with quickly disappearing white head.
Grainy corn malt flavor with more vanilla flavor than in aroma. 
Medium light bodied with medium high co2, lingering vanilla bean flavor. Some slickness on the tongue. 
Enjoyable beer I might prefer it more without the vanilla though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can from beers of europe. Color is orange. Head is very thin and white. Taste is light to medium sweet and bitter. Aroma and flavour is vanilla, milk, honey, herby.

220217. Can from Bucket Boys. Dont see a lot of cream ales here in Australia, which is a shame as it is a good beer style. Sweet vanilla finish to this beer makes for a nice change. Great looking can and great beer as well.

On tap at Mother Earth, pours a clear straw yellow with a small white head. Nose brings out creamsicle and straw. Flavour is similar, with creamsicle, straw and cereal malt. Light sweetness on the finish. Better than the average cream ale, but thats not saying much.

Sampled on draught at Todd Englishs P.U.B. At Aria in Las Vegas. Clear golden colour. Taste is vanilla with a hint of heather honey. Very smooth and creamy, but no bitterness to speak of. A beer designed for ladies who dont much like beer, I suspect.
First sip, tastes like a cream soda, not too overpowering, delicious. I couldnt drink a lot of these, too sweet, but a great treat to have one.
It smells like crisp cream soda, with a vanilla flavor. Clean and delicious.

Can from the craft beer advent calendar courtesy of Pix. Cheers! Blond with a white head. Metallic grain aroma with a touch of vanilla. Lots of vanilla in the flavour along with spice and grain. Some creaminess. A bit artificial feeling. OK.

Can pours mostly clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is straight cream soda, vanilla prominent, slight corn notes. Flavor is also cream soda, maybe a little less sweet, minimal hop character. Fairly light and crisp. Interesting and good for the style.
A pale ale, very mild toasted malt with vanilla cream soda flavor. The finish is slightly hoppy but not much. Slightly hazy pale straw color.
On nitro at Henrys Tavern. The best cream ale Ive had, so smooth and creamy with a medium body and a hint of vanilla.
Tap @ Angels Trumpet Ale House: Clear gold sweet butterscotch aroma with a smooth vanilla sweet flavor to follow. Easy to drink.

355 ml can.
Pours clear golden color with a small head. Very strong vanilla on the nose, toffee, faint orange, malts and toast. Flavor is vanilla and toffee, toasted bread, yeast and some malt bitterness on the finish. Quite pleasant.
5324

This is one hell of a dirty name. 12 ounce can. Pours a clear golden yellow color with a medium white head. A big sweet toast nose. Vanilla, soft hay, big round sugary malt. This is a lot like a cheap pale lager, I dont mean that as an insult, thats just what it is. Super drinkable. OK.
Can - pours pale gold with a white head. Aroma is like rice pudding, vanilla dominates. Taste is vanilla with a malt backbone. Not as cloying as i feared.
Can. Pours hazy gold. Aroma of vanilla, cream soda snd marshmallow. Sweet vanilla taste with strong notes of cream soda. This one wasnt quite for me.
Bottle to glass. Vanilla really dominates both the aroma and flavor. There is a nice fullness in the mouthfeel. Not much here except the vanilla.

22 oz bottle poured. Nice to see Mother Earth make their way to Seattle. I remember how much I used to seek out their beer, and now I can turn my attention to something else. Clear golden pour with a soap bubble head. Nice vanilla incense aroma. Flavor is odd to me. At least not what I expected. Nilla wafer, cookie like dominant. The vanilla is much stronger than I anticipated. Creamy for sure. Cream soda like for sure, but comes off as a bit cardboard like for some reason. Big time cereal like character. Overall, this cream ale is unique, which is already a lot more than others in the style can say. Not a lot less than good going on. I like it.
Not as creamy as Id hoped but very pleasant. Smells lovely. Nice and light on the palate. As close to cream soda as youre likely to get in a beer. Harry Potter fans would approve.

355ml can from Beers of Europe. Fairly clear pale golden colour with a small white head, slightly unfiltered appearance. Sweet aroma of delicious vanilla ice cream, malt. Taste is sweet, creamy, it really is almost like a cream soda as they describe it - like drinking melted vanilla ice cream with alcohol in it, and being beer-like... somehow it just works really well. Really smooth mouthfeel too. I love it.

Can from the Guildford Arms. 
Appearance - golden with a decent head. 
Nose - like vanilla ice cream or buttermilk even.
Taste - more of the same. 
Palate - close to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a fairly good finish. 
Overall - Id written off this whole style but this is the first one Ive enjoyed.

Pours a light golden color with a medium creamy head. Aroma is malty with a hint of vanilla. Feels a bit watery and creamy. Flavor is slightly bitter with a nice aftertaste of vanilla cream. Pretty good beer. One of my favorites!

Refrigerated 12 oz. aluminum can poured into a glass. Hazy deep golden with small white head. Aroma is cream, medium creamy body, lower carbonation, and thin good small-bubble lacing. Taste is cream and Pilsner malt. Quite good really.

Can, canned 09/08/15. Pours golden with whiteish head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, malt, grains. Flavor is sweet, vanilla, malt, grains, some grapefruit. Overall: good, vanilla works surprisingly well in this one.

355ml can at home shared with mother, from Good Spirits Company, West Nile Street, Glasgow (bb 31 Oct 2016), vanilla, grain aroma, straw with a lively thin bubbly off-white head, corn, honey, vanilla flavour, quite gassy, pleasing vanilla aftertaste.
Can at the Guildford arms... Amber.. Big white head.. Soft biscuits fruit nose... Big sweet vanilla.. Soft biscuits.. Light biscuit malts
Aroma is pale malts/grains and mild sweetness. The flavor is vanilla/almost vanilla ice cream, pale malts, fruit and a mix of tart and slight sweetness in the finish.
Out of a can. Slightly hazy golden. Thick dense white head. Light pale malt aromas and flavors. Significant vanilla spice and rather firm body. A little noble hop for balance.

Bottle. Golden beer with a strong head. The aroma is caramel and creamy, and the flavour is bitter with creamy, caramel and toffeeness. Overall a nice creamy and toffee caramel beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz can had while on spring break in San Diego.

As advertised, tastes like cream soda, with alcohol
Great. A bit sweet. Tastes like a cream soda with a touch of booze. Easy drinkin.

Bottle shared with a friend. This looked pretty exciting. Then I was let down. Just nothing to get excited about. I think that always happens to me with cream ales. Maybe I am expecting a Cream Soda????
Canned from Trader Joes. Creamy lager tasting. A little vanilla. Tastes like cereal grains. Super grainy with a touch of hops.

Can picked up at the Co-op. Hazy golden straw color with a persistent white head, bits of sticky lacing. An inviting aroma of sweet honey, vanilla, and corn flakes. Tastes mostly sweet with light hints of grassy bitters. Nice use of the honey and vanilla. Really smooth and flavorful. If more cream ales were like this Id seek them out.
Very strong vanilla scent, but not strong vanilla taste. Average carbonation. Very clear gold color. Not something that will give u a buzz. Good for light drinkers.
Clear light gold. White head. Honey. Grain/straw. Artificial vanilla. Mild grassy bitterness. I dont get the cream soda here. Not bad I guess, but this isnt really for me.
A sweet vanilla, almost something citrusy, cream soda type aroma and taste. Aroma a little less sweet than taste. Decent dessert type beer.

Can (5.2% ABV) from Bottle Baron. Hazy golden body with a thin white head. Steady carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of vanilla ice-cream and custard. Flavour of cream soda, orange Angel Delight and biscuit. Thin body with a watery, slightly oily mouthfeel. Light fizz. Sweet and easy to drink.

5.8%ABV. Cream Ale.

Tapped out a hazy golden amber. 10ºSRM.

Nose has some sweet creamy vanilla aromas, like when infusing a cream with vanilla pods in the preparation of a vanilla ice cream. Candy sweet aroma. Like opening a can of sweet hard candy. There is also the aroma of kettle corn.

Mouthfeel is sudsy and smooth. There is a good carbonation allowing palate of cream corn, sweet malt and some floral-ness bloom. Orchids or carnations maybe. A hit of something creamy smoky like burnt milk or scorched Spanish cream or creme brulee.

No hops. Slight beery finish. Pretty clean.
A fairly strong vanilla in the aroma, this has a nice full head. This certainly is a cream ale, one of the creamiest Ive had in a long time. That said Im just not much of a vanilla guy

On tap @ Sheraton Quinns Alehouse. Medium golden hue, clear, with a thin white head. Aroma is vanilla cookie with light coffee undertones. Sweet vanilla biscuit through and through. Low bitterness. Clean. Well, if cream ale can have an ambassador, then maybe this serves.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Rating #1511 - 16.03.2015 - On tap at The Local (Pacific Beach). Clear, copper coloured pour with a decent tan head, good retention. Aroma is vanilla, ginger,toasty malts,hint of nuttiness, caramel. Taste is very bready, hint of dry maltiness.Creamy mouthfeel, with a bread pudding type vibe thats sustained in a smooth finish.

Very smooth vanilla-ey flavor beer. Do yourself a favor and find it on nitro as it compliments it perfectly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from trade. Cloudy golden pour with minimal head. As it warmed theres more Vanilla in the aroma. Pretty smooth and drinkable. Good cream ale.
Like 6.99 bomber bottle of a yellow fizzy watery beer. No aroma except some wet grain. No hops crystal clear pee yellow. Not getting it for price. 805 is better at half price.

12 oz can. Pours hazy golden with a thick off-white pillowy head with great retention; laces a little. Aroma is strong in vanilla; also some breadiness. Taste is strong vanilla backed by a nice grassy hoppiness. Tastes like a nice craft hoppy pilsner with added vanilla sweetness. I like it.

Super clear light Amber colour and thin fading white head. Aroma - doughy, bread, vanilla, slight honeyed sweetness. Taste - obviously vanilla and creamy, soft mouthfeel, soft carbonation, malty. Kinda does what it says on the can
Bottle pour. Cloudy golden with a white creamy head. Aroma is vanilla and cereal. Medium smooth body. Very sweet with a slight salty finish.
On tap at PreFunk. This is what cream ale is all about. Big chewy body, semi sweet, small tight, very head. Pure malt aroma, more pure malty goodness in the taste. Smooth and slick and tasty.

Keg at Cherry Reds, Birmingham. Clouded gold with white head. This was certainly quite creamy and definitely vanilla. Like drinking melted ice cream, not the most pleasing of flavours in a beer, there is a fruity alcohol note. Not sure about this.

I wish they would have left out the vanilla. It really smells like a fine beer. And first taste is refreshing. Then the weird vanilla kicks in and you can forget the vanilla cough medicine flavor. Disappointing. Can says it's their most popular beer. That scares me about what else I may find.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is light honey, sweet cereal and vanilla. Taste is creamy breakfast cereal (Honey Bunches of Oats). One of the better Cream Ales Ive had.

Poured from the bomber into an English pint glass. Golden color with a white head. Aroma is cereal and vanilla. Flavor is lightly malty/grainy with some sweetness and mild vanilla and cream. Medium bodied with a fairly soft mouthfeel and a bit of sharpness on the finish from the carbonation. Cream ales arent really my thing in general, but this is a pretty decent example.
12oz can pours out a clear crisp golden topped with a small white head. Nose is cream soda sweetness vanilla and some malty notes. Taste is more of the sweetness cream soda vanilla.

Can @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus. Hazy golden color, small white to off-white head. Aroma is lightly malts, a lot of vanilla and sweet. Taste lightly malts, again a lot of vanilla, just as much as I can handle, sweetish. Average body and carbonation.

Can @ home shared by benzai. Clear golden colour with a small to medium sizes white head. Smells vanilla, sweet, malts. Tastes lovely vanilla, malts, some hops.. Somehow a very nice combination. I really like vanilla though. Thin to medium body, nice carbo.

A nice refreshing cream beer. Pours a cloudy orange with a soapy white head. Smells slightly of vanilla. Taste is obviously creamy, with a lager backend, some cereal and nuts, and lots of vanilla and cream on top. Good summer beer.

Poured into my Teku glass, cloudy golden with a dirty white good sized head. Nose is reminiscent of vanilla cream soda for sure. Medium bodied with good carbonation and an oily texture. Not bad, but not great. Bought to make Ice cream sodas along with some Hard Root Beer, preferred the RB.
Can. Golden with an off white foam. Caramel, vanilla and cream with wheat. Mellow lemon with hints of honey. Bready yeast with toasted cereal and a biscuity finish. Decent.
Expensive yellow fizz in 22 oz bottle. Cool bottle probably the price hike. Nothing of any value no malts not even sweet malts just o cool bottle with mickeys in it.

355ml. Can. 
Pours clear yellow with white head. 
Aroma vanilla, bread, dough, toffee, chocolate, cream. 
Taste sweet cream, little bitter. 
Mouthfeel thin. 
First cream ale. Nice.

Can from BeerMott, Manchester. It pours clear amber with a thick, white head. The nose is soft, sweet, big cream soda vibe, vanilla and general creaminess. The taste is crisp, bitter - sweet, creamy, toasty grain, cream soda, straw, light alcohol boost and some chewiness with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate + carbonation. Smells pretty crazy, but taste falls a bit flat. Good fun anyhow.
BBOTMC. Pours orange with a nice head, aroma of caramel, vanilla, toffee, flavor of cream, vanilla, toffee, medium bodied.

Draft pour at Churchills. Poured a creamy golden yellow color with a small white head. Aroma was light vanilla notes, yeah... vanilla. Interesting. Cream soda consistency. Interesting brew. Pretty tasty actually.
Pours a golden orange color with a white head. Biscuit, vanilla, grass, honey, fruit and cream aroma and flavors. Medium light body and moderate carbonation. Vanilla finish. A little extracty.

Can from Rehills, Newcastle. Hazy amber coloured with a thin white head. It has a rich vanilla and creamy toffee flavour followed by a warming fruity and more vanilla finish. Very like an American Cream Soda!

On draft. Golden yellow pour, with a slight haze, and a white head. Biscuit, grain, background flavor of vanilla reminiscent of cream soda, and notes of citrus. Pretty enjoyable actually. The vanilla is in moderation, and adds an interesting and fun flavor to the beer.

Amber, slightly hazy with a small white head. Medium body. Some sweet malt and light touch of zesty fruit. Vanilla doesnt stand out by itself but does give that essence of cream soda. Maybe even a bit minty, before an orange peel bitter finish.
Aroma of malt, wheat, cream, artificial vanilla, sweetener, faint hops. Flavour is medium sweet with a light bittersweet finish. Too artificial, too much like cream soda, not for me.

Clear gold with a nice dense head. Aroma light and herbal. Taste grainy with, for some reason, a very strong milk chocolate note.. not sure why, maybe its just the way I perceived the vanilla. Pretty good, at any rate
12oz can from Hippo Beers. Amber with a good foamy head. Vanilla aroma and flavour. Dry marzipan aftertaste. Very unusual.
Can, bbotmc. Hazy red-amber with a white head. Vanilla, some caramel, some coconut in the nose. Vanilla, bitter, somewhat grainy taste. Medium body, fairly carbonated, pleasing vanilla finish.

This one took me by surprise and I had to look it up to make sure I got the right beer. I was expecting a standard cream ale by what I got was a full flavored, amber, spiced up brew. Vanilla dominates, sweet malt, spice. Medium body. Finish has a hint of that vanilla and spice. Half a pint was enjoyable but the full pint was a bit much.

Off of nitro tap pours straw colored with smooth creamy white head. Aroma is mild vanilla. Flavor is smooth and refreshing creamy vanilla. Very light and smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
sample from can, poured a cloudy amber colour with a slight off head. nose of sweet caramel, vanilla, crisp malts, metallic notes, orange peel, spiced notes, creamy mouthfeel.

Keg at The Font, Chorlton. Hazy orange with a short white head. I like the aroma. The vanilla comes through nicely, making it seem like a cream soda. Taste is maybe a step down but about right for this style. Sweetish and a bit minerally. Decent enough.

can - 1st beer from ME makes me very curious about the others, as this is a style I rarely really like. This, though, was one of the best Ive had. Creamy vanilla nose and flavor without being artificaial, and a smooth body with some cracker flavor and pale malt. Probably THE most complex Ive ever had in style, and one of the best.

Appearance was clear golden with creamy white 1 finger head, rings of lacing. Aromas are sweet pale malts, hints of floral hops then the burst of vinallia. Taste are sweet malt sweetness and corn upfront, mid sip is vinallia. Hops are earthery and herbal with hints of lemon on the end. Palate was soft smooth CO2 with light body, then average length soft drying balanced finish. Overall I like the brew, but the hops.

Can shared at a tasting at Ariels place. Better Beer Of The Month Club. Hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of vanilla and stale hops. Sweetish flavor with vanilla and a bitter stale hops. Medium-bodied.

330ml Can at Twisted Barrel brewery USA tap takeover.

Poured hazy amber ith white head.
Nose is cream soda and vanilla.
Taste is Vanilla ice cream, cream soda, light wheat.
Nice !
Bottle share round at Richys. Hazy gold. Film of white head. Vanilla custard aroma. Taste is light sweet, turning light dry. Body to match. Finishes soft, vanilla sweet.

27th June 2015: Bomber, split between five at the 2nd Annual Midlands tasting. I picked this up while in the US, but the beer is available in the UK now at certain outlets. Poured a slightly hazy deep golden colour, the head a wispy affair. Vanilla Ice Cream please Mister! As I used to say to the mobile Ice Cream van driver as a child. Maybe not so creamy as an Ice Cream, but certainly Vanilla in flavour and sweet. Different and enjoyable: 6th beer into the tasting and a welcome change after two heavy hitting American IPAs.

2nd annual Midlands tasting group. Bottle shared thanks to Blackhaddock, cheers Jeremy. Golden Amber beer with small head. Aroma of vanilla, custard and boiled sweets. Taste is vanilla, custard and pale malts. Very easy to drink. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: 23rd June 2015Lightly hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry with mild fine carbonation. Light sweetish malts with well integrated vanilla. Modest spice. Mellow candy orange, light peel and a trace of mint. Light finish. Nicely joined up and pretty drinkable.
Bottle midlands tasting group. Dark gold thin head. Aroma cream vanilla taste same deffo ice cream soda good sweetness light hoppy bitters. Ok body. Good stuff.
Klares kräftig goldenes Bier mit einer geringen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch sehr karamellig, viel Vanille, cremig. Geschmack sehr cremig, eine Menge Vanille, Karamell.

Can from Cotteridge Wines; hazy amber pour with a thin bubbly off white head, this does have a creamy smell along with some vanilla and sweet malts, taste has a cream soda like flavour, along vanilla, a hint of citrus and caramel.
On tap at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours golden with thick white head and a whipped cream aroma. There is a sweet pale malt flavor with a creamy finish. Interesting.

Can. Pours a clear golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma of cream soda, vanilla, subtle banana, some caramel and oats. Taste of oats, wheat, some bread, subtle vanilla, a little lemon and cereal. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A sweetish, bready finish. A malty beer with only a subtle vanilla taste, mainly cereals and bread. Not bad but I expected more.
Bottle at La Rue, golden color with tight foam, aroma and flavor has a creamy texture not unlike the cream soda you have had, mild creamy finish
Pours clear yellow. Slight white head. Smells notably of vanilla and light grains or corn. Flavor is more vanilla, sweetness with a crisp finish. Thanks to Benny B for hauling goods back from Cali!

From a bomber. Pours opaque amber copper with a fizzy white head. Tastes like strong vanilla, creamy coffee, citrus hops, and bready malt. Light/medium body and carbonation. Smells like vanilla, bready malt, some sweet coffee, and a hint of citrus hops.

Bottle. Pours mostly clear gold with off-white head. Aroma is pale malts, wheat, vanilla, cream, and faint banana. Flavor is dry malt base with soft vanilla sweetness and faint floral hops. Light/medium body.
Bomber. Pours a copper orange with a white head and aroma of malt and caramel. Taste is light, of malt, caramel, bread and biscuit notes, light hops.

With Z, pours a rusty copper color with a small head. Nose is slight vanilla otherwise unimpressive. Taste is slight vanilla cream, but  off  and not very agreeable ! Less than average , a very flat, rather uninteresting ale . Quaff Score 6 / 10
Expensive 22 oz bottle for yellow fizzy beer. Grains and banana and bitterness with no hop character at all. The bitterness comes from strange grains. No head but fizzy.

머더 어스 브루어리- 캘리포니아 크리밍 5.2% ABV 재미있는 브루어리 명과 재미있는 브랜드 명. 스톤과 발라스트 포인트의 샌디에이고에 소규모 브루어리로 추천받아 마신 맥주. 걍 크림 소다맛 나는 에일맥주.
https://twitter

This beer is a clear pale straw-gold color with a medium fluffy white head that recedes steadily. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Aroma of vanilla, wheat and grain. Light-bodied with flavors of sweet vanilla, biscuit malt and wheat. Slight hops here and there as well. The finish is malty with a vanilla aftertaste. Decent overall.

The aroma is average. Malt is steel reserve. There is no hops. No noticeable yeast. But you have to be a real vanilla lover to appreciate this beer. I stick to vanilla for ice cream. It has a smooth finish nonetheless that is a good break from harder& edgier beers.

Can. Gold with a loose white head. Aroma of popcorn, cheap vanilla ice cream. Sweet, taste is as suggested by the smell, but theres a little bread too and a little lick of lemon, iron and pepper in the slightly bitter finish. Not my sort of thing at all.
This is a really nice easy drinking cream ale. Nice flavor, touch of caramel and some floral hop touches. Really smooth beer.
On tap at source, good beer but but not great nothing much to it other than grain water. No bad stuff going on but nothing else, expensive for what it is but not rated on cost.
Pint on draft at Coaster bar at Mission Beach in San Diego. Cloudy and cold. Not any head. Vanilla.

Bomber picked up for ~ $4 at Costco. Clear amber pour with a nice white head. Just a hint of white lacing. Nose has a hint of vanilla and some bread / cracker notes. Taste is pretty nice, but I get a lot of vanilla that I dont necessarily want. First few sips it tasted very artificial. Not my thing.

Pour is a clear dark golden with a large white head. Aroma is a decent amount of vanilla but not much else. Flavor is again a nice vanilla but nothing else shows up. My experience with cream ales is that there is nothing exciting about them so the addition of vanilla is great but thats all there is and its kinda artificial at that.

Expensive grain tea..wet grain flavor real lean tons of rocky head and fizz way better than a coors. But not worth price. Drink this one real cold if you are forced to drink. Or just bite bullet and get their Kismet.

Bottle. Pours clear dark gold with a large, rocky white head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is soft and sweet vanilla, biscuit and Pils malt. Flavor is crisp malt, light vanilla, light spicy hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
12 ounce can. Pours a light clear gold with a nice white head. Aroma of vanilla. Taste is vanilla, citrus, and malt. Does taste like a cream soda. Would be nice to drink one every so often.

Bomber - this was a pleasant surprise on a 90 degree Thanksgiving Day. Gold pour with white head. Nose of vanilla mainly. Taste resembled cream soda. I have had several in this style before but none with this strong of a vanilla presence. Quite enjoyable.
Bottle shared by Ken at Capitol Beer. Pours brassy gold with a white head. Aroma is pretty much vanilla. Med body. Flavor is lightly sweet cream soda. Very good cream ale. Quite clean.

This is quite delicious. It tastes pretty much like Cream Soda in beer form. Theres a little bit of an off quality, slightly metallic, but otherwise this is nearly perfect for what I want from the style. Really really good.

Pours a golden pale color with a thick white head. Aromas of honey, fresh grains and vanilla bean. Flavors are similar to the nose with more earthiness and light touch of hops. Definitely a great session beer!

Poured from a can. Orange color with a creamy head. Not much lacing. Major vanilla aroma. Same with the taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Type: 22-oz. bottle
Glass: Karl Strauss pint glass
From: Costco in Mission Valley (San Diego), Calif.
Price: $4.79
Purchased: Aug. 27, 2014
Consumed: Aug. 29, 2014
Misc.: N/A

Poured a honey, golden, straw, semi-clear color with 1-to-2 fingers of khaki tan head that withered away fairly quickly. A good deal of bubbles coming up from the bottom of the glass. Below average wet watery lacing along the sides of the glass. Below average retention on the top all the way down. (Sight - 3.53)

Smelled honey, vanilla, cream, sweet sugary corn, caramel, light grape and some rye malts. (Smell - 3.75)

Taste was much, much better. Got vanilla cream, caramel, honey, vanilla extract, grass, Cream Soda and amber malts. Reminded me of a very good American Adjunct Lager. (Taste - 4.00)

Light body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Long, sweet finish. Something slightly off late on the tongue, but still a nice feel. (Feel - 3.94)

A very good cream ale. I dont know how many Ive rated so far, but this one went down easy. Close to an AAL in my opinion, but not quite. Sweet, sugary, vanilla goodness. (Overall - 3.90)

3.90 88 B+
(tap) clear, bright light orange amber colour with a small white head; aroma of toffee, caramel; balanced flavour, like the aroma, long light bitter finish
San Diego Summer Trip 2014 - Golden in color, clear with a thick white head. Creamy in flavor with a good malt mix. Easy hops backing this was nice and tasty.

Pours a medium orange with a half finger white head with just a little lacing. Aroma is of vanilla, citrus, wheat, and marshmallows. Taste is vanilla, wheat, marshmallow, citrus, light bitterness, and biscuit malts. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a bittersweet, medium finish. Overall, a very interesting beer that is nice for a rather mediocre style.
This is a very good cream ale very light and easy tasting with the vanilla after tones and was very good on the pallet.

The aroma has strong notes of vanilla that make it smell just like Cream Soda! since its a light body beer its the vanilla is the main flavor which will not make this beer everyones favorite but it is definitely one of mine

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2014 A light, effervescent summer brew with fleeting notes of vanilla and oats. A much better, creamier ale than similar styles. A sweet, dessert nose and a silky body give this Vista offering some gusto.

Draught at Mother Earth Tasting Room in Vista. Pale golden beer with a small white head. Malty toffee aroma, cream, butter, caramel, some biscuits. Malty caramel flavor, vanilla, cream and biscuits. Too sweet.

When you buy a cream ale, I suppose you should expect a cream ale. The cashier at Costco seemed to think this bottle was generating a great deal of local controversy and agitated mumbling, so I thought Id give it a try and see how the beer version differed from the canned, sugary and carbonated version I essentially grew up on. And minus a little sugar? I cant say theres much of a difference. Cream ale, it turns out, tastes a great deal like cream ale. It has that distinctive sweeter element, marshmallow on the nose, a moderate to lope carbonation, and a taste that is more than nostalgic - its almost identical to root beers younger and slightly less social little brother. Like some fruit ales, its hard to think of this as a true beer, though I am glad to have tried it. However, the sooner this circulates out of Costco (and the sooner it no longer raises controversy around Costcos hallowed halls) the better.
Not horrible, but waaay too much vanilla in this for me. First loser from an otherwise excellent brewery.

22oz bottle from The Beerhive 
Cloudy golden with a medium sized white head and good lacing. Aroma is vanilla, wheat and citrus. Flavors of vanilla, straw and grassy 
Nice, lots of flavor

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2014 Bomber, had at brewery initially and rated low, but had in bomber and really good. Lots of vanilla all around. Orange pour, white head, nose is vanilla, taste is vanilla, im liking it.

Short: Vanilla flavored cough syrup 
[ Mother Earth ][ Tap ][ 2oz ][ Taster ][ $1-2 ][ 1/25/14 ]
Long: Clear golden pour, weak lacing. Nose is honey, macro lager esque, lemon. Medicinal cough syrup taste with over the top vanilla bean. Papery finish.
Flaws: Medicinal, papery

Smells like sweet cream soda. Pours murky copper with a minimal white head. Tastes like a cream soda mixed with beer, I think I would like it more if it was less beer flavored and more cream soda flavored.
Golden with a white head - there is some hops in the aroma - Malt body with some hops as well and a taste of vanilla - Mlats and vanilla goes into the finish - This was kind of good
Really does have kind of a cream soda flavor, kind of weird. Might be great for someone that doesn't like the taste of beer.
Clear orange amber with an off-white head and decent lace. Vanilla is prominent, accompanied by honey, pepper and grain. Medium body, minimal carbonation and a corn-like finish.
Bottle; poured a dull dark gold with a whitish head. Aroma of vanilla, bread, and touch of sweetness. A lot of vanilla and some buttery sweetness. Nice palate.

Pours a light amber color with a cream soda aroma. Taste is slightly bready with a doughy aftertaste. Also, a creamy bitterness left on the tongue. The sweetness is evident yet subtle. This beer is a good representation of a cream ale.
Hazy golden color, moderate head, decent lace/retention. Aroma is vanilla, light caramel, citrus. Medium to light bodied, somewhat similar to a cream soda, enjoyable.

Bomber courtesy of Perrin515 (Thanks Patrick) poured a clear tarnished gold with a lingering ring of off white foam. Aromas of straw, vanilla and light honey. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of vanilla, bread and light earthiness with a crisp dry lingering vanilla finish.

22oz bottle. Pours amber with a white head. Nice amount of bitterness followed by a vanilla, cream soda finish. The vanilla flavor tastes a little medicinal. It's not something I could drink a lot of or often. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer has a slightly sweet aroma of caramel. It has a gold color. It has a hint of cream soda flavor but isn't very sweet. It has a nice bite to it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Yes marshmallow cream. If you like that type. A little thick for a cream ale. But not too bad. Couldnt drink the whole 22, just because its not my style. But good beer if this us your cup of brew.

Tastes like a damn creamcicle! Really refreshing while being essentially whipped-cream beer. Not overly sweet or sticky, but with a smooth body and refreshing finish. Most cream ales are crap beer, this one actually has a great creamy taste!

Location/Date:Bottle on July 27th, 2013 split with Dave and AV.
Appearance: Pours a orange cloud. 
Aroma: Aroma of mostly vanilla.
Taste: Really tastes like cream soda - vanilla, light caramel, sweet.
Palate:Medium, sticky.
Summary: Not really like any other beer Ive had, really interesting, great for warm weather(in San Diego, year round) or summer(where I am).

On tap @ Mother Earth. Cloudy golden pour with a white head. Nose is vanilla, cream soda, and marshmallow. Sweet toast, some fruity esters, and strawberry. The flavor is really nice, but quite sweet. Marshmallow, vanilla, and cream soda notes. A bit of bread and toast, some strawberry, pear, and apple. I dig it.

Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a moderate white head. Hints of light caramel and sweet, cream soda notes. Taste is strongly resemblant of cream soda. Light in body with a strong sweetness. Delicious.

At ZDKs tasting.  Cream soda.  The aroma is caramel, sweet, cream soda.  The appearance is orange, white head, like cream soda.  The flavor is just like cream soda, sweet, vanilla.  The finish is sweet, vanilla, caramel, cream soda.  The is he best cream soda I have ever had, especially considering that its a beer.  Enjoyable enough.

Bottle at a tasting at Matts place.  Pours a lightly hazed gold with a thin to medium sized white head.  Smells like cream soda, and Ill go ahead and say thats a fine thing.  I love me some cream soda.  Medium bodied, a bit grainy and tart before moving into the cream soda element.  Undoubtedly artificial but I really dont mind.  Tasty enough.
Bottle shared by James at Zach & Matts tasting. Pours yellow gold with a medium white head. Aroma and taste is all cola and cream, with some notes of vanilla: quite simply, cream soda!

Bottle from South Bay Liquor:  Poured with a thick lather of foam head that grew like whip cream spray but within half a minute rapidly retreated leaving behind a thin layer of film on top. The liquid was rather peculiar with a hundreds of thousands of tiny bits of sediment floating about in equilibrium whereas the color was a glowing yellow hue. The aroma is subtle with minimal scent of cereal like malts that also has a pinch of grain or hay that gives this a fuller bodied smell than most other cream ales I have come across. The flavor of this beer is true to the cream ale style and sort of brings about flavors of an actual cream soda or a root beer float but at the same time has a touch of vanilla extract and light taste of nuts and honey cereal. Surely one of the better cream ales I have sampled.
UPDATED: APR 21, 2013 Bottle shared by me at tasting. Pours orange gold with white head. Nose and taste of cream soda. Spot on. Thats it. Some vanilla. Medium body.
This is quite simply cream soda.  It smells like cream soda and tastes like cream soda.  This isnt beer.  Its awesome though.
Funny name, not sure I like it.  Actually, I hate it! Pours a very pale yellow.  Typical corn and cereal grains with a light dose of hops.  Ok.
From a bottle poured an amber color with a small amount of head.  Fake vanilla flavor with a lasting aftertaste.
From a bottle, clear gold color, aroma is fairly weak with some light grains and a little vanilla.  Taste is light with vanilla creaminess.  Decent, good for the style.

Pours a light amber with medium tan head. Little retention or lacing. Aromas of banana, spice, and a little Belgian yeast? Very reminiscent of a subdued witbier/blonde. Taste is much of the same with a mild vanilla right before the finish. Finish is sweet with a lingering vanilla oiliness.
clear dark yellow. Not a ton of aroma to speak of. Classic blonde ale type flavor with a defineed vanilla note.
Clear golden with a creamy white head. Faint grain and vanilla aroma. The vanilla bean gives it a nice flavor but the palate is too thin to carry forward.
